comment_text: I'm honestly glad I found this video. I've been watching these for a while. I used to have a 3D puzzle when I was a kid of the Tower of London which brought back nostalgic memories. In the video just so happens to be about a castle.

I’ve never done one of these puzzles. I think I’d love to try to do one. I used to do them when I was a teenager. My dad got the family a big round puzzle that was all paint splatter. Man it was hard! Took us months to do it. You’d do a little every now and then. Probably the hardest we ever did.
How complicated is the cutting die! Man you’d need some serious patience.

That's so cool. Would be cool if you could order a house like this out of giant jigsaw blocks, and take it down and move it, or redesign it whever you want. Order a new piece if something breaks lol. Have them made out of some kind of strong but light insulated material. I'm sure it must be possible. Hand these little jigsaw houses out to the homeless, so they can take it around with them and put it up like a tent

Can we stop using the word technician. They're just ordinary workers doing extremely simple tasks. There's nothing technical about picking things up and putting things down. The only real master here is the dye maker.
